section.title: NAME
section.p: explain - Return the access plan of the current cursor.

section.title: DESCRIPTION
section.p: Return the access plan of the current cursor.

plentry.pd:
Access plan execution plan, now we have: Run field: whether execute the Access Plan. True is to execute, get data and time information; False represents only get the Access Plan's info, but not executing it.
Name (string) Collection Name.
ScanType (string) Scanning Type: TableScan: "tbscan"; IndexScan:"ixscan"
IndexName (string) Index name.
UseExtSort (bool) Whether use external sort or not.
NodeName (string) Node Name.
ReturnNum (int64) Number of returned records.
ElapsedTime (float64) Elapsed Time(seconds).
IndexRead (int64) Number of Index read.
DataRead (int64) Number of data read.
UserCPU (float64) Time used by cpu in user mode(seconds).
SysCPU (float64) Time used by cpu in kernel mode(seconds).
SubCollections (Json Array) The access plan of each sub-collections of the vertical-partitioning collection.

ul.li: If the collection is splitted into different replica groups, each replica group will return its own access plan correspondingly.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Suppose foo.bar is a horizontal-partitioning collection splitted in three replica groups.
